title: Our Culture at Harbor & Ember
content: At Harbor & Ember, hospitality comes first. We believe every guest should feel welcomed, cared for, and confident in our team. Great service is proactive, professional, and warm. Anticipate needs, communicate clearly, and take ownership of every table you serve.

title: Professional Expectations
content: Arrive in full uniform, clean and pressed. Maintain polished shoes, neat hair, and minimal fragrance. Be on the floor ready to serve at your scheduled time, not walking in the door.

title: The Perfect Greeting
content: Greet guests within 30 seconds with eye contact and a smile. Introduce yourself by name, offer water, and highlight any featured cocktails or specials. A strong first impression sets the tone for the entire experience.

title: Pacing the Experience
content: Watch guest body language and table progress. Clear plates promptly, offer the next course naturally, and communicate delays honestly. The goal is a relaxed, unrushed meal that still flows smoothly.

title: Seafood & Allergen Awareness
content: Many of our dishes contain shellfish, dairy, and gluten. If a guest mentions an allergy, stop and clarify. Repeat it back, notify a manager, and mark it clearly in the POS. Never assume or guess.

title: Upselling with Confidence
content: Upselling is about guidance, not pressure. Suggest appetizers for the table, recommend a wine pairing with entrées, and always mention dessert options before presenting the check.

title: Pairing Drinks with the Menu
content: Recommend crisp whites with seafood, bold reds with steaks, and signature cocktails as an experience, not just a drink. Use phrases like, 'Our Ember Old Fashioned pairs beautifully with the NY Strip.'

title: POS Accuracy & Seat Numbers
content: Repeat every order, confirm temperatures and modifiers, and use seat numbers when available. Accurate orders reduce remakes, comps, and guest frustration.

title: Turning Mistakes into Wins
content: Acknowledge the issue, apologize sincerely, and act quickly. Never place blame. Involve a manager early—speed and care matter more than finding fault.

title: Sanitation & Clean Service Standards
content: Wash hands frequently, avoid touching food-contact surfaces, and keep stations clean. Clean menus, check presenters, and pens regularly.

title: Opening Sidework Standards
content: Set up your section completely before guests arrive. Stock stations, check table alignment, fill ice and beverages, and review specials with management.

title: Closing Sidework Standards
content: Restock for the next shift, wipe down stations, sanitize tables, and complete checkout. Get manager approval before clocking out.
